title.narrative: COVID RESPONSE - EDUCATION

description.narrative: School Operational Guidance designed and approved by MOE and made available on line, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased number of children aged 5-18 access quality inclusive early and basic education in a child-friendly and protective environment.

System strengthening - mainstreaming of skills development within national education/training system
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: School Operational Guidance designed and approved by MOE and made available on line

description.narrative: In partnership;with MoE, schools and communities, UNICEF adapted its programming to focus not only on when children go back to school, but how they get back to learning. UNICEF’s education response to COVID-19 has focused on mitigating against lost learning and accelerating learning recovery, for the most vulnerable children, and to improve teaching and learning long term, by building back a more resilient education system. The MoE-UNICEF Learning Bridges programme reached 499,765 children (65 per cent female) through the provision of printed and online learning materials,to support home study and provide learning support during school closures. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
